page.title: 01 A General View
page.content: The land in our squares has the villages of Hanbury,Coton in the Clay and Fauld. From the top of Hanbury Hill or from the church you can see right across the Dove valley.The river Dove is the boundary between Staffordshire and Derbyshire.We are in Staffordshire.All the land is farmland except for the Gypsum mines.There is not much for the visitor to see or do but to go for walks or look at the church. St.Werburgh's church is very old and big.There are some interesting monuments and stained glass to see. Other interesting buildings to look at are the school,Far Fillimore Rest Home,The Thatches and New Lodge.New Lodge used to be the home of the Axebearer of Needwood Forest.It is now a private school.
